DOC.brief_summary: The purpose trial determine Ventana Fenestrated Stent Graft System safe effective endovascular repair juxtarenal pararenal aortic aneurysm .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Effectiveness Trial Ventana Fenestrated Stent Graft System
DOC.criteria: Male female least 18 year old ; Informed consent understood sign patient agrees followup visit ; Have aortic aneurysm maximum diameter ≥5.5cm , 4.5 5.5cm rapidly expand ( > 0.5cm six month ) , > 50 % large normal aortic diameter Anatomically eligible Bifurcated System per FDAapproved indication use ( IFU ) Fenestrated Stent Graft System : Adequate iliac/femoral access compatible require delivery system Nonaneurysmal infrarenal aortic neck < 15mm length ; Most caudal renal artery aortoiliac bifurcation length ≥70mm SMA aortoiliac bifurcation length ≥90mm ; Proximal nonaneurysmal aortic neck SMA : diameter 18 34 mm ; length ≥15 mm ; angle ≤60° aneurysm sac ; Angle ≤60° ( clock face ) SMA CA Renal artery distal SMA ≤35mm , within 30mm axially , 4 8mm lumen diameter , clock face angle 90° 210° .Common iliac artery distal fixation site : distal fixation length ≥15 mm ; ability preserve least one hypogastric artery ; diameter ≥10 mm ≤23 mm ; angle ≤90° aortic bifurcation . The Endologix Fenestrated Proximal Extension Stent must ability overlap bifurcate stent graft least 3cm . Aortic diameter caudal renal artery 18 36mm Life expectancy < 2 year judge investigator ; Psychiatric condition may interfere study ; Participating enrollment 30day followup phase another clinical study ; Known allergy device component ; Coagulopathy uncontrolled bleed disorder ; Contraindication contrast medium anticoagulant ; Ruptured , leaking , mycotic aneurysm ; Aortic dissection Serum creatinine ( SCr ) level > 2.0 mg/dL ; Traumatic vascular injury ; Active systemic localize groin infection ; Connective tissue disease ( e.g. , Marfan 's Syndrome ) ; Recent ( within prior three month ) cerebrovascular accident myocardial infarction ; Prior renal transplant ; Length either renal artery stented < 13mm ; Significant occlusive disease either renal artery ( > 70 % stenosis ) ; An essential accessory renal artery ; Indispensable inferior mesenteric artery ; Aneurysmal disease descend thoracic aorta ; Clinically significant mural thrombus circumferentially suprarenal segment ; Prior iliac artery stent implant may interfere delivery system introduction ; Unsuitable vascular anatomy ; Pregnancy ( female patient childbearing potential ) Existing renal stent ; Preplanned need concomitant procedure ( e.g . surgical conduit vascular access , hypogastric artery embolization/coil , renal artery angioplasty )
